H0.text: The north magnetic pole is where recent rocks point towards on Earth.

H1.text: Space is where recent rocks point toward on Earth.

H2.text: Equator is where recent rocks point towards on earth.

H3.text: South magnetic pole is where recent rocks point towards on Earth.

A4.text: As the magma seeps out of the mantle, cools, and solidifies into igneous rock, it is imprinted with a record of the direction of the magnetic field at the time that the magma cooled.

A5.text: The north magnetic pole, also known as the magnetic north pole, is a point on the surface of Earth's Northern Hemisphere at which the planet's magnetic field points vertically downward (in other words, if a magnetic compass needle is allowed to rotate in three dimensions, it will point straight down).
